title: The Mammoth Book of the Adventures of Professor Moriarty - Maxim
description:
The Mammoth Book of the Adventures of Professor Moriarty: 37 Short Stories about the Secret Life of Sherlock Holmesâ€™s Nemesis by Maxim Jakubowski (Editor) 
English | 2016 | Mystery, Thriller & Suspense | 1.12 MB 

The hidden life of Sherlock Holmesâ€™s most famous adversary is reimagined and revealed by the finest crime writers today. 
Some of literatureâ€™s greatest supervillains have also become its most intriguing antiheroesâ€”Dracula, Hannibal Lecter, Lord Voldemort, and Norman Batesâ€”figures that capture our imagination. Perhaps the greatest of these is Professor James Moriarty. Fiercely intelligent and a relentless schemer, Professor Moriarty is the perfect foil to the inimitable Sherlock Holmes, whose crime-solving acumen could only be as brilliant as Moriartyâ€™s cunning. 
While â€œthe Napoleon of crimeâ€ appeared in only two of Conan Doyleâ€™s original stories, Moriartyâ€™s enigma is finally revealed in this diverse anthology of thirty-seven new Moriarty stories, reimagined and retold by leading crime writers such as Martin Edwards, JÃ¼rgen Ehlers, Barbara Nadel, L. C. Tyler, Michael Gregorio, Alison Joseph and Peter Guttridge. In these intelligent, compelling storiesâ€”some frightening and others humorousâ€”Moriarty is brought back vividly to new life, not simply as an incarnation of pure evil but also as a fallible human being with personality, motivations, and subtle shades of humanity. 
Filling the gaps of the Conan Doyle canon, The Mammoth Book of the Adventures of Professor Moriarty is a must-read for any fan of the Sherlock Holmesâ€™s legacy.
